definition.value: DHBs provide (or fund the provision of) health and disability services to 20 districts throughout New Zealand.
Community Trusts are non-profit organisations that provide health and disability services, and do not include Charitable Trusts.
This includes both national and local government bodies but excludes DHBs.

A Trust is a group of people (Trustees) who agree to hold money or assets and carry out activities for the benefit of certain other people (beneficiaries), or in the case of a Charitable Trust, for the benefit of the community, and does not include Community Trusts.
Organisations that receive government funding to provide a set service. All non-governmental organisations that are not charitable trusts.
Responsible Authorities are Listed in the Health Practitioners Competency Assurance Act 2003.
Research institutions not involved in education.
Education institutions - these may include those involved in research, e.g. universities.
PHOs are the local provider organisations through which DHBs implement the Primary Health Care Strategy.
An association for independent practitioners that is not a PHO.
A hospital that is not a public facility.
An organisation that includes the business of dispensing pharmaceuticals.
Where one or more medical practitioners are practising.
Where a service is provided in an office environment including specialists, physiotherapists, dentists, laboratories, radiology clinics, etc.
